title: What are the coordinates of the point at -540 degrees on a circle of radius 3.3 centered at the origin? - Quora

response.answer_text: Rotation is clockwise , 540° means required point lies on x-axis where x co-ordinate is negative and y co-ordinate is naturally 0. As radius is 3.3 cm reqd. point of intersection with negative side on x- axis is ( –3.3, 0)
-540-mod-360=180. With radius of circle at 3.3units, centred at origin (0,0), the coordinates of the reqjuired point on the circle is (-3.3,0). Trust this helps.
540=(360+180)°=> -540°=-360°-180°=-3×180° => 3 times the straight angles below the 0° line.=> radius being 3.3 units, the position of the point is (-3.3 units,0). Ans..
